intro: Psychotria nanifrutex, commonly known as the dwarf psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests. Psychotria nanifrutex is also noted for its role in ecological interactions, particularly as a host plant for certain species of insects.
